Topic.Title: Speaking of awards...

Message.Msg: "As they say in Texas, “Hell, what’s a little air pollution among friends?" Well Echo, perhaps contrary to your thinking, we aren't idiots down here. Last month, the Texas comptroller kicked off the 2013 legislative session projecting an $8.8 billion budget surplus for the coming fiscal period. Gov Perry, in his state of the state address, urged legislators to give some of the money back to the state's tax payers. Unheard of, right? A politician that cares about the folks footing the "bills". I'm sure you find that insane. And before you hit me with some areas where Texas isn't number one, I'll tell you right up front we don't believe in being number one at all cost. Are there areas where we can improve, sure. But, this state is governed in a fiscally sane way prudently balancing the needs of its citizens. If we don't have the money, we don't spend it. If we have the money, we don't spend it all. We don't see the state's businesses and taxpaying citizens as bottomless pits of money. Call us whatever you like, but I'm proud to live here and it is well documented that others from around the country are increasingly seeking us out as they try to escape fiscal insanity.

Topic.Title: wow... this is what i am talking about!

Topic.Title: Ban Democrats from guns

Message.Msg: - Waiting in line for the bus, a Pennsylvania kindergartener tells her pals she's going to shoot them with a Hello Kitty toy that makes soap bubbles. -In Maryland, two 6-year-old boys pretend their fingers are guns during a playground game of cops and robbers. In Massachusetts, a 5-year-old boy attending an after-school program makes a gun out of Legos and points it at other students while "simulating the sound of gunfire," as one school official put it. - GETTYSBURG, Pa. (AP) — Police in Pennsylvania say a student's report of a gunshot being fired was instead the sound of a newspaper hitting the sidewalk. Gettysburg police Chief Joseph Dougherty says a Gettysburg College student had reported that someone in a white sedan fired a shot early Saturday morning. But Dougherty says police investigated and determined the sound came from a newspaper delivery driver throwing a paper from her vehicle. No, but we don't over react, we don't overreact...just keep repeating it and new gun laws will suddenly appear and not change a thing. So Lib’s, how many gun deaths are attributed to legally purchased weapons? How many of those are attributed to ‘assault’ weapons? How many are attributed to illegally purchased or stolen weapons? How many are caused by normally law-abiding citizens versus previously convicted criminals?

Topic.Title: Speaking of awards...

Message.Msg: ... “Well Echo, perhaps contrary to your thinking, we aren't idiots down here.” I never said that you were ALL idiots down there. I was referring to pinhighshot, who attempted to criticize the Polk Awards with no clue what he was talking about. He is a MSM conspiracy lunatic like the others I referenced in my post. He is an idiot. The Frogg agrees with him. The Frogg is an idiot. Jon, who spent Monday searching his pantry for fruitcakes, only to find The Frogg, also agrees with him. Jon, likewise, is an idiot. Windandale, et. al., all of whom refuse to accept that the very short-lived impact of The Tea Party has ridiculed itself into oblivion, with part of that being the denial of legitimate news sources in favor of Rush, Glen Beck & Fox, are all idiots…as are the aforementioned sources…and Ann Coulter is the Queen of all idiots. Not ALL idiots live in Texas, but some do. Rick Perry governs the biggest state polluter in America – call that business friendly if you like – One fourth of kids in Texas live in poverty, while the state ranks a lowly 42nd for educational attainment and income while ranking FIRST in the disparity between rich and poor. “…it is well documented that others from around the country are increasingly seeking us out…” Given the above, we can readily see why and who they might be…oil companies, anti-regulatory industrialist polluters, and others of the 2% who think 47% of Americans are bums. Rick Perry also thinks global warming is a hoax, embraces intolerant fundamentalist paranoia, is a former Democrat and would like to see the great state of Texas secede from The United States. Rick Perry also made a fool out of himself in the debates, thus proving he is an idiot. Texas Congressman Steve Stockman wants to impeach President Obama if any executive orders are issued to strengthened gun control laws. Mr. Stockman also embarrassed your state by fawning over noted psycho, Ted Nugent, inviting this clown (who threatened the President as well as telling NRA members to "ride into that battlefield and chop [Democrats'] heads off in November" to the State of the Union address. Texas Congressman Stockman is an idiot. Ted Nugent, although not from Texas, is also an idiot. And, t.bfine, when you agree with those above, I can only conclude that you are also an idiot. However, often you are far more moderate and in your recent diatribe, you stated that you actually agree with many elements of additional gun control regulation. That certainly does not jibe with the other idiots listed, and you cannot have it both ways. You know as well as I do, that universal registration of handguns is a very good thing embraced by nine out of ten Americans, and in no way infringes on the 2nd Amendment. Why do you find it impossible to comment on that when the windanjon’s on this board intentionally lie about it? Then again, last year you said that all the Democrats in Texas would be shot. Now, THAT was idiotic! In your defense, you’ve got some great music in Austin.

Message.Title: If $85.3 billion is cut from a $3 trillion plus budget will America cease to exist?
Message.Msg: Our federal government spends about $11 billion per day. The sequestration cuts about $233,698,630.00 from that daily expense. So according to our "dear leader" in his speech today, if the federal government only has $10.76 billion to spend on a daily basis, then people will get cancer, law enforcement will stop doing their jobs, children will stop being educated, our "dear leader" may have to take fewer multi million dollar vacations, and other draconian effects. Who would have thought that $233 million would have had such a major effect on America's ability to perform its functions? Why can't Republicans understand that our "dear leader" is a reasonable man and is willing to go the extra mile if only they will raise taxes a little bit more on the rich? "In your heart you know he is right." The Frogg
